Event.name: Activity_resume
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> resumes participation in an <fen>Activity</fen>. Progress on the <fen>Activity</fen> is retained from before the interruption.
<ex><fex name="act">Normal Service</fex> Will Be <t>Resumed</t> <fex name="Time">Shortly</fex>. <fex name="age">CNI</fex></ex>
<fex name="age">The Kinshasa government</fex> has <t>resumed</t> <fex name="act">supporting Rwandan rebels</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of <fen>Time</fen> for which the <fen>Activity</fen> is resumed </def-root>

Arg.name: Activity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Activity</fen> which is being resumed by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>We have <t>renewed</t> <fex name="act">our efforts to gain federal recognition</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the <fen>Activity</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also mark indications of salient characteristics of the <fen>Agent</fen> which affect the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<ex>The stock market <t>resumed</t> trading <fex name="Manner">in an orderly fashion</fex> on Monday</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> who resumes an <fen>Activity</fen> that they were engaged in earlier.
<ex> <fex name="age">We</fex> <t>renewed</t> our efforts to get things completed.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>his FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The consequence of the resuming of the <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>n general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: renew.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: resume or re-establish after an interruption.

lexUnit.name: resume.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause to begin again or continue after a pause or interruption
